titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7705

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Military Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteers
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE.
Louisville, September 18 1862
Hon: D.C. Wickliffe
Sec: of State
Sir

William O. Watts was Commissioned 2d Lieutenant this 18 September 1862 --
=W. L. Sharp Surgeon has resigned: date of Com: June 14. 1862=

=Septr 19, 1862.
The Commissions are issued to
Otto Ernst Captain
Albert M. Green -- 1st Lieut:
Christopher Bybee -- 2d. Lieut: } all dated this day --
Colo Jesse Bayles heretofore mustered out of service -- is re-instated by order of the President of the U. States -- approved May 13th 1862 --
James P. Hendrick Chaplain -- Com. issd. Sep. 5, 1862 --

20th Septr 1862 --
Com: issd & delivered to: Joseph Gunter 2d Lieutenant -- date 20th Septr 1862
Do J. F. Fleming Surg: same date --
Do Wm H Newman Surg: same date --
Do L. L. Pinkerton Surg: date 18 Sep. 1862
L. L. Pinkerton Asst. Surg: promoted date of Com: August 13th 1862 --
Com: issd & deld to Augustus G. Hatz 2d Lieut: date 1 Sep: 1862 --
2d Lieut: John W. Washburn was killed in battle Aug. 30, 1862 -- date of Com. Oct. 20, 1861 --
George W. McMillen Surg: mustered out of service -- date of Com. Dec 11, 1861
John M. Duke Surg: declined -- Com. dated Aug 30, 1862 --
Jasper H. Johnson Comd 2d Lieut: date Sep. 20. 1862

Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl Ken. Vols:
